info.name: Oracle Fusion Cloud FIN - Budgetary Control Results Budget Impacts
info.description:
REST API collection for Oracle Fusion Cloud Financials â€” Budgetary Control Results Budget Impacts module.

Created by [Adrian Anderson](https://www.linkedin.com/in/aanderson1017/) | [YouTube - Better Human Applications](https://www.youtube.com/@BetterHumanApplications)

item.name: Budgetary Control Results Budget Impacts
Get the budget impacts of a budgetary control result

header.description: The protocol version between a REST client and service. If the client does not specify this header in the request the server will pick a default version for the API.

If the REST API supports runtime customizations, the shape of the service may change during runtime. The REST client may isolate itself from these changes or choose to interact with the latest version of the API by specifying this header. For example: Metadata-Context:sandbox="TrackEmployeeFeature".

variable.description:
(Required) This is the hash key of the attributes which make up the composite key--- BudgetCcid, ControlBudgetId and PeriodName ---for the Budgetary Control Results Budget Impacts resource and used to uniquely identify an instance of Budgetary Control Results Budget Impacts. The client should not generate the hash key value. Instead, the client should query on the Budgetary Control Results Budget Impacts collection resource with a filter on the primary key values in order to navigate to a specific instance of Budgetary Control Results Budget Impacts.

For example: budgetaryControlResultsBudgetImpacts?q=BudgetCcid=<value1>;ControlBudgetId=<value2>;PeriodName=<value3>

query.description: When this parameter is provided, the specified children are included in the resource payload (instead of just a link). The value of this query parameter is "all" or "". More than one child can be specified using comma as a separator. Example: ?expand=Employees,Localizations. Nested children can also be provided following the format "Child.NestedChild" (Example: ?expand=Employees.Managers). If a nested child is provided (Example: Employees.Managers), the missing children will be processed implicitly. For example, "?expand=Employees.Managers" is the same as "?expand=Employees,Employees.Managers" (which will expand Employees and Managers).

This parameter filters the resource fields. Only the specified fields are returned, which means that if no fields are specified, no fields are returned (useful to get only the links). If an indirect child resource is provided (Example: Employees.Managers), the missing children will be processed implicitly. For example, "?fields=Employees.Managers:Empname" is the same as "?fields=;Employees:;Employees.Managers:Empname" (which will only return the "Empname" field for Managers). the value of this query parameter is a list of resource fields. The attribute can be a direct (Example: Employees) or indirect (Example: Employees.Managers) child. It cannot be combined with expand query parameter. If both are provided, only fields will be considered.

Format: ?fields=Attribute1,Attribute2

Format for fields in child resource: ?fields=Accessor1:Attribute1,Attribute2
The resource item payload will be filtered in order to contain only data (no links section, for example).

This parameter specifies dependencies which are fields that are set before and rolled back after generating the response. Generally they are used to preview the effects of an attribute change. The fields specified in this parameter are always set in the resource instance in question. When a child resource collection is requested and the parameter is set, the fields will be set in the parent resource instance before generating the resource collection payload. The value of this query parameter is a set of dependency fields. Example: dependency=ProductId=2

Format: <attr1>=<val1>,<attr2>=<value2>

This parameter can be used to show only certain links while accessing a singular resource or a resource collection. The parameter value format is a comma-separated list of : <link_relation>

Example:
self,canonical

The resource item payload will be filtered in order to contain only data (no links section, for example).

This parameter can be used to show only certain links while accessing a singular resource or a resource collection. The parameter value format is a comma-separated list of : <link_relation>

Example:
self,canonical
This parameter restricts the number of resources returned inside the resource collection. If the limit exceeds the resource count then the framework will only return the available resources.
Used to define the starting position of the resource collection. If offset exceeds the resource count then no resources are returned. Default value is 0.
The resource collection representation will include the "estimated row count" when "?totalResults=true", otherwise the count is not included.  The default value is "false".

This query parameter defines the where clause. The resource collection will be queried using the provided expressions. The value of this query parameter is one or more expressions. Example: ?q=Deptno>=10 and <= 30;Loc!=NY

Format: ?q=expression1;expression2

You can use these queryable attributes to filter this collection resource using the q query parameter:
  • AccountedPayablesAmount; number; Reserved payables expenditure amount.
  • AccountedProjectAmount; number; Reserved project expenditure amount.
  • AccountedReceiptsAmount; number; Reserved receipt expenditure amount.
  • ActualAmount; number; Consumption amount spent and classified as an expenditure.
  • AdditionalRequired; number; Amount needed beyond the remaining budget funds available to cover the cost of a specific transaction.
  • Amount; number; The transaction amount in the budget currency.
  • ApprovedAuthorizationAmount; number; Reserved spend authorization amount.
  • ApprovedCommitmentAmount; number; Reserved requisition amount.
  • ApprovedObligationAmount; number; Reserved purchase order amount.
  • BudgetAccount; string; The budget account for the transaction.
  • BudgetAdjustmentAmount; number; Changes made to the initial budget amount.
  • BudgetAmount; number; The total budget balance amount.
  • BudgetCcid; integer; The budget account identifier for the transaction.
  • BudgetManager; string; The budget manager who manages the control budget.
  • CommitmentAmount; number; Consumption amount expected to be spent without a legal obligation.
  • ControlBudgetId; integer; The control budget identifier.
  • CurrencyCode; string; The currency of the control budget.
  • DetailOtherAmount; number; Reserved encumbrance amount excluding commitments or obligations.
  • EnteredAmount; number; The entered transaction amount in the transaction currency.
  • FundsAvailableAmount; number; Funds available amount for consumption.
  • FundsConsumed; number; The amount consumed from the control budget.
  • MiscExpendituresAmount; number; Reserved expenditure amount excluding payables, receipts and projects.
  • Name; string; The control budget name.
  • ObligationAmount; number; Consumption amount with a legal obligation to pay in the future.
  • OtherAmount; number; Consumption amount for encumbrances excluding commitments or obligations.
  • PeriodName; string; The name of the budget period.
  • ResultCode; string; The budgetary control validation status code for the transactions.
  • Status; string; The budgetary control validation status. A list of accepted values are defined in the lookup type XCC_BC_ACTIVITY_STATUSES.
  • TotalConsumption; number; Total budget consumption amount consisting of expenditure amounts incurred and amounts at different degrees of committed stages.
  • TransactionNumber; string; The source transaction number for the budgetary control validation request.
  • UnreleasedBudgetAmount; number; Budget amount that's not released for consumption.

This parameter orders a resource collection based on the specified fields.  The parameter value is a comma-separated string of attribute names, each optionally followed by a colon and "asc" or "desc".  Specify "asc" for ascending and "desc" for descending. The default value is "asc".  For example, ?orderBy=field1:asc,field2:desc

Used as a predefined finder to search the collection.

Format ?finder=<finderName>;<variableName>=<variableValue>,<variableName2>=<variableValue2>

The following are the available finder names and corresponding finder variables

  • PrimaryKey Finds the budgetary control results budget impacts with the specified primary key.
    Finder Variables
    • BudgetCcid; integer; The budget account identifier for the transaction.
    • ControlBudgetId; integer; The control budget identifier.
    • PeriodName; string; The name of the budget period.
  • resultsFinder Finds the latest budgetary control results budget impacts with the specified finder variable.
    Finder Variables
    • DataSetId; integer; The budgetary control validation processing data set identifier.
    • DraftFlag; string; The funds check versus funds reservation indicator.
    • SourceHeaderId1; string; The source transaction identifier 1.
    • SourceHeaderId2; string; The source transaction identifier 2.
    • SourceLineId1; string; The source transaction line identifier 1.
    • SourceLineId2; string; The source transaction line identifier 2.
    • SourceLineId3; string; The source transaction line identifier 3.
    • SourceLineId4; string; The source transaction line identifier 4.
    • SourceLineId5; string; The source transaction line identifier 5.
    • TransactionTypeCode; string; The source transaction type code.

item.description: The budgetary control results budget impacts resource can be used to view budgetary control validation information with budgetary control balances for a requisition in Self Service Procurement, a purchase order in Procurement, or a labor schedule from Labor Cost Management in Project Management.
